SECRET TOP SECRET217DRAFT QFjOPBNING SPEECH.My Lords and Members of the House of commons. My Husband and I greatly look forward to our coming visit to Australia and New Zealand. 1 have the happiest recollectionof our visit in 1953 and 1954, and it is a source of deep pleasureto Me that we can renew our acquaintance with those great and growing members of the Commonwealth.2. My Government regard the development and improvementof relations between East and West as one of the most importantaims of their policy. They will maintain their support for theUnited Nations, and they will continue to work for international agreement on general and complete disarmament. They willpersevere in their efforts to secure a treaty banning nuclear tests.3. My Government will seek to strengthen the bonds whichlink the countries of the North Atlantic Alliance, which has a powerful contribution to make in maintaining the peace of theworld. My Government will also take a full part in the work ofother international bodies of which the United Kingdom is amember and will strive by all possible means to ensure thesecurity and increase the prosperity of all countries in the free world.4. In co-operation with My allies, My Armed Forces will maintain their contribution to the prevention of war.5. My Government are resolved to stand by their obligations towards the people of West Berlin, and will continue, togetherwith their allies, to strive for a settlement which safeguards thefreedom and security of the city.6. My Government have welcomed the proposals put forward by the United Nations for conciliation in the Congo. It is theirhope that the fair implementation of these proposals may lead tothe co-operation of all elements in the Congo in the vitaltask of reconstructing that country.7. My Ministers have long recognised the great political andeconomic importance of the development of the european communities and the opportunities which British accession tothese Communities would bring. In close consultation with theother members of the Commonwealth and of the European free trade Association and wi^n^hoseJinterests in the United kingdom which are particularly concerned,, they will use every effort tobring the current negotiations to a successful conclusion,/ Inthis event^legislation will be laid before you.-1- 8. / My Government will continue to seek a soliition to theproblems of Central Africa.^/9. Legislation will be introduced to provide for the Stateof Singapore, North Borneo and Sarawak to join the proposed new Federation of Malaysia.10. You will be asked to make further provision for develop-rnent and welfare in oversea territories and to extend the present powers of the Colonial Development Corporation.11. My Ministers will encourage men and women from thiscountry to offer their services for work in developing countires overseas, whether in the service of oversea Governments, asspecialist advisers, or under schemes of voluntary recruitment.Members of the House of Commons1Z, Estimates for the public services will be laid before you.My Lords and Members of the House of Commons13, My Ministers will continue to promote economic expansionon a sound basis, with a high and stable level of employment.14. My Ministers will pursue their aim of improving thebalance of oversea payments and maintaining the strength of sterling. In co-operation with other Governments they will giveconstant attention to means of sustaining a rising level of world trade.15. My Government will continue to give support to theagricultural and fishing industries and will lay before youproposals about certain miscellaneous questions affectingagriculture.16. My Government will seek improvements in the social conditions and in the health and welfare of My People. A bill will be introduced to extend the powers of local authorities inconnection with the care of children, and to give effect to other recommendations which have been made by the Committee onChildren and Young Persons.17. My Government will continue to give attention to measures for the further protection of consumers. They will introduce legislation to bring up to date and extend the Weights and measures Acts and will establish a Consumer Council to representand promote the interests of consumers.18. Fresh provision will be made for securing the health,safety and welfare of persons employed in shops and offices. 19. My Government are preparing a Bill which will prescribeminimum periods of notice of termination of employment.^/20. Plans will be laid before you for the development inEngland and Wales over the next decade of the health and welfare services of the local authorities, in parallel with the develop-ment of the hospitals,21. Further steps will be taken to improve the supply of teacherfor the schools. The expansion of university and technical education will continue.22. A Bill v/ill be introduced to increase the pensions of retired members of the public services and their dependants.23. A The position of war pensioners and those who are receiving national insurance benefits will be kept under closereviewj24. Legislation v/ill be proposed for the re-organisation oflocal government in Greater London.25. Legislation will be required to amend and continue theoperation of the Television Act, 1954.26. A Bill will be introduced to provide for the conservationand development of water resources in England and Wales.27.
